1380279261731434498.text: We know all too well the dangers of rampant circulation of assault-style firearms in America, where our people are 25 times more likely to die from gun violence than people in other developed countries.

1380279260238254083.text: The NFA Modernization Act would enact a long overdue yet modest increase of the tax from $200 to $300 and tie the increase to inflation starting in 2022. The additional revenue would fund federal gun violence prevention programs. https://t.co/KdG0CfUupW

1380279252428288004.text: The National Firearms Act was enacted in 1934 to deter the circulation of firearms that were used to commit crimes by imposing a $200 tax on the transfer of these weapons. A tax of $200 in 1934 would equal a tax of $3,925 in 2021. https://t.co/6RJcDcA1Co

1380279251220492289.text: The National Firearms Act (NFA) Modernization Act would modestly increase the tax paid to transfer weapons regulated by the NFA—including machine guns, short-barreled rifles and shotguns, and silencers—and funnel the additional revenue to federal #gunviolenceprevention programs.

1380279249781800962.text: The SAFER Act would make it a federal offense to return firearms to the person from whom they have been confiscated, acting as a greater deterrent than the existing patchwork of state transfer laws. https://t.co/VBsiLSitL2

1380279243884670976.text: It’s troubling that there’s no federal law banning the return of guns to people who have had their gun licenses revoked or their guns removed by court order. We saw the deadly cost of this regulatory loophole in the 2018 Nashville Waffle House shooting: https://t.co/HnLZew7nrB

1380279242261475329.text: Today I proudly introduced two bills to deter the transfer of guns to dangerous individuals, deter the transfer of assault-style weapons, and increase funding for federal gun violence prevention programs: https://t.co/eqGnGnBLSU
